Class Parser<T,P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.tiko.objectorientedprogramming.JSONparser.Parser<T,P>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Any class that can be saved in String form.
    P - Any class that can be saved in String form.

extends java.lang.Object

      • createItem

                       P second)
        Creates an Item object from two given parameters.
        Parameters:
        first - Can be of any type. Turned into String and used as a tag.
        second - Can be of any type. Turned into String and used as a property.
        Returns:

      • setFilename

        public void setFilename(java.lang.String filename)
        Changes the default name for save file.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file where saving occurs. Must be at least three letters long.

      • createJsonLine

      • convertItemsToJsonLines

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> convertItemsToJsonLines(java.util.List<Item> items)
        Turns a list of Items into Strings which can be used in a JSON file.
        Parameters:
        items - List of Items to be showed in JSON form
        Returns:
        List of JSON forms of Items.

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item item)
        Input an Item for the Parser. Parser turns the Items given into JSON form and saves them as a String list. Items can later be written into a file all at once.
        Parameters:
        item - An Item that is wished to be added.

      • addAllItems

        public void addAllItems(java.util.List<Item> items)
        Input a list of Items for the Parser. Parser turns the Items given into JSON form and saves them as a String list. Items can later be written into a file all at once.
        Parameters:
        items - List of Items that are wished to be added.

        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file where the information is to be saved.

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile()
        Read a JSON file and parse it into Items. Open the default file and read it into a list of Strings. Turn the strings into a list of Items.

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Read a JSON file and parse it into Items. Open the default file and read it into a list of Strings. Turn the strings into a list of Items.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file where the information is to be saved.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Intializes all lists empty and returns the default name for savefile.

      • fileIntoItems

        public java.util.List<Item> fileIntoItems(java.lang.String filename)
        Read a JSON file, parse it and return a list of Items. Open the default file and read it into a list of Strings. Turn the strings into a list of Items. Return the list.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file where the information is saved.
        Returns:
        List of parsed Items.

        Parameters:
        objects - List of Objects wished to be parsed.
        Returns:
        The given Objects as a single JSON line.
